author: SUDEEP LAVANIA
description: In Etah, Uttar Pradesh, four men were acquitted after an 11-year gang-rape trial when the woman admitted the crime never occurred. The court ordered action against the woman and her husband for filing a false case, and against the investigating officer for a flawed investigation.
title: After 11-year trial, 4 acquitted in fabricated 'gang-rape' case

author: AMISHA RAJANI
description: Stricter visa enforcement and dwindling job opportunities are creating significant hardships for Indian students in the US. Many are facing financial strain due to revoked visas, workplace inspections, and limited work hours, forcing them to cut expenses drastically and seek family support.
title: ‘Rent, rules & reality’: US visa crackdown hits Indian students hard

author: SOUMITRA BOSE
description: Arun Gawli, the notorious Mumbai don, was released from Nagpur Central Prison after the Supreme Court granted him bail in a 2007 murder case. After 17 years behind bars, Gawli expressed a desire to reconnect with his family and grandchildren. His release was marked by tight security due to threats from Dawood Ibrahim's D-Company.
title: SC grants bail after 17 years: Gawli exits Nagpur jail; family reunion on his mind

author: SACHIN PARASHAR
title: ‘Help speed up EU FTA’: Jaishankar presses Germany on FTA; Ukraine war also discussed

author: GLOBAL SPORTS DESK
description: Kansas City Chiefs anticipate challenges for their upcoming game in Sao Paulo. Travis Kelce mentioned the long bus ride from the hotel to the stadium. Patrick Mahomes joked about teammates' understanding of global geography. The team will face an eleven-hour flight followed by a lengthy bus journey. Kelce is excited to see the fan reaction in Brazil.
title: Chiefs in Brazil: Kelce frets long ride; Mahomes jokes on geography

author: TNN
description: The GST Council has approved a major overhaul of the indirect tax system, introducing a simplified two-rate structure of 5% and 18%, along with a 40% slab for select goods. Effective September 22nd, these changes aim to reduce tax burdens on common goods, eliminate classification disputes, and boost consumption.
title: GST revamp: Life & health cover, white goods, most cars to get cheaper; reforms effective Sept 22

author: GLOBAL SPORTS DESK
description: Josh Allen acknowledges Hailee Steinfeld's fame, noting her 'rockstar' status during their travels abroad. He embraces playing 'second fiddle' and appreciates her success. Sources indicate their marriage has brought personal stability, enhancing his confidence and poise on the field, suggesting a positive impact on his performance and leadership.
title: ‘She’s a rockstar’: Josh Allen hails Hailee; credits her for stability

author: TNN
description: The GST Council has approved significant rate cuts across various sectors, effective September 22nd, providing relief to consumers and farmers. Daily-use items like hair oil, shampoo, and toothpaste will now attract a reduced 5% GST, while health and life insurance are entirely exempt.
title: Sitharaman’s ‘Diwali gift’: From paneer to paratha, Centre explains tweaks in GST rates; FAQs

author: TNN
description: The government anticipates businesses will pass on the benefits of lower GST rates to consumers. The CBIC will engage with industry to ensure compliance, with indications suggesting a positive response. While the anti-profiteering agency is disbanded, the provision remains, and guidance will be issued for goods already in stock, allowing businesses to claim credit for the reduced tax.
title: With GST rate cuts, govt expects lower prices to reach consumers

author: MOHD DILSHAD
description: In Aligarh's Daunkoli village, Archana, a 35-year-old woman, allegedly jumped from her roof after enduring years of dowry-related abuse. A video surfaced showing the aftermath, leading to a police case against her husband and in-laws. They are accused of demanding additional dowry of Rs 5 lakh and a motorcycle.
title: Dowry case: 'Jump', says hubby, terrified woman flings self from 2nd-floor house, critical

author: DHANANJAY MAHAPATRA
description: West Bengal has cautioned that granting governors the power to decide the fate of bills would undermine states' legislative functions. The Supreme Court's timeline for governors and the President would expedite the process of turning people's will into laws. The Constitution does not assign governors a dominating position in state legislative or executive functions, according to the TMC government.
title: Guv's absolute discretion on bills means negating people's will: Bengal in SC

author: TOI WORLD DESK
title: 'Illegal retaliation': Judge blocks Trump administration’s Harvard grant cuts

author: BHARTI JAIN
description: Ahead of PM Modi's Manipur visit, the Centre, Manipur government, and Kuki-Zo insurgents are poised to extend their Suspension of Operations (SOO) agreement. Talks in Delhi show promise, potentially tweaking SOO terms to relocate Kuki-Zo camps and directly deposit remuneration to cadres.
title: Manipur talks: Centre, Kuki-Zo near pact; PM Modi visit expected Sept 12-13

author: MANOJ CHAURASIA AND CHANDRA SHEKHAR JHA AZAD
description: In a rare turn of events, a jail in Madhubani, Bihar, became the venue for a wedding between an inmate and his widowed sister-in-law. The accused, facing charges of sexual exploitation, married the woman following a Patna High Court directive. The court granted bail on the condition that the marriage be verified.
title: Bihar jail turns into a wedding venue for rape accused, survivor

author: TNN
description: Relentless monsoon rains have triggered devastating floods and landslides across Himachal Pradesh, J&K, Punjab, and Haryana, resulting in at least 500 deaths. Thousands are stranded as highways are blocked, rivers surge above danger levels, and crops are flattened. Punjab has declared a state of disaster, while rescue efforts continue amidst widespread destruction and infrastructure damage.
title: Monsoon fury: 500 death toll mounts to 500 in HP, J&K, Punjab, Haryana

author: GLOBAL SPORTS DESK
description: MrBeast's new YouTube video playfully envisions owning the NFL, setting the stage for a historic event. YouTube will stream a live NFL game between the Chargers and Chiefs from São Paulo, Brazil, on September 5, 2025. This marks YouTube's first exclusive NFL broadcast, featuring creator involvement and interactive elements, blending sports and digital entertainment.
title: MrBeast teases NFL takeover: Bold claim drops on YouTube; Chargers vs Chiefs buzz builds

author: TOI WORLD DESK
title: Portugal tragedy: At least 15 killed in Lisbon’s Gloria funicular accident - video

author: TNN
description: Punjab Police are actively searching for AAP MLA Harmeet Singh Pathanmajra, who is accused of sexual exploitation and other charges. Pathanmajra released a video denying allegations of attacking police during an attempted arrest in Haryana.
title: Rape case: AAP MLA says he feared encounter; denies attack on police

author: TNN
description: Floods across north India have severely disrupted education, leaving students like Suresh Rawat unable to attend school after a bridge washed away. Schools in Punjab, Himachal, and Jammu have been repeatedly closed due to flooding and landslides. Damaged infrastructure, stranded teachers, and lack of access have halted classroom routines, with makeshift arrangements proving insufficient.
title: School bells stop ringing in flood-hit North India as water cuts off access

author: GLOBAL SPORTS DESK
description: Mitch Marner's departure from the Toronto Maple Leafs to the Vegas Golden Knights for a lucrative $96 million contract was fueled by serious safety and privacy concerns. Harassment, including home address exposure and threats, prompted his exit. GM Brad Treliving emphasized the organization's commitment to player safety, acknowledging the unfortunate reality of social media's darker side.
title: Brad Treliving responds to Marner: Safety concerns revealed; Leafs star exit stirs buzz

author: TOI BUSINESS DESK
description: The GST Council has approved a major overhaul of the Goods and Services Tax system, slashing rates on several everyday items. Roti, hair oil, ice creams, and televisions are set to become cheaper. We answer 75 FAQs about the GST rate rationalisation:
title: GST rate cuts from September 22! 75 FAQs answered

author: TOI BUSINESS DESK
description: Prime Minister Narendra Modi announced next-generation GST reforms. These reforms aim to improve citizens' lives and ease business operations. The GST Council agreed to rate cuts and reforms proposed by the Union Government. Nirmala Sitharaman announced major GST rate cuts, implementing a two-tier tax system. Common man and middle-class items will see reduced rates.
title: 'Common man to benefit': PM Modi hails GST rate cuts; calls it wide-ranging reform

author: TOI BUSINESS DESK
title: Big relief: 0% GST on individual health, life insurance; reduced from 18%

author: TOI BUSINESS DESK
description: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman announced significant GST rate cuts, effective September 22, bringing relief to the common man. Daily use items like hair oil, soaps, and toothpaste now fall under the 5% tax bracket. Several items, including ultra-high temperature milk and paneer, face zero tax. Air conditioners, TVs, and small cars are now taxed at 18%.
title: GST rate cuts! What is cheaper & dearer? Check full list of items in each slab

author: ARNAB LALL SEAL
description: India faced a disappointing start in the Super4s stage of the Asia Cup, drawing 2-2 with South Korea after leading early. Despite Hardik Singh's initial goal, South Korea surged ahead with two quick goals. Harmanpreet Singh's late assist to Mandeep Singh salvaged a draw, but India's poor finishing and missed penalty corners highlighted a lackluster performance.
title: Hockey Asia Cup: India settle for 2-2 draw against South Korea in Super 4s match in Rajgir

author: TOI WORLD DESK
description: Amidst ongoing conflict, Russian President Vladimir Putin expressed openness to a trilateral peace initiative with US President Donald Trump and Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy, proposing Moscow as the venue. However, Ukraine swiftly rejected this, deeming it a cynical ploy.
title: 'Let Zelenskyy come to Moscow': Putin on Trump's trilateral peace meet proposal

author: TOI BUSINESS DESK
description: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman announced significant GST rate cuts following the 56th GST Council meeting, implementing a two-tier structure of 5% and 18% effective September 22. The rate rationalization, supported by all states, aims to benefit the common man by consolidating rates and reallocating items across tax slabs.
title: Major GST reforms: 0% levy on Indian breads, paneer and milk

author: TOI BUSINESS DESK
description: The GST Council has approved a new 40% tax slab for sin and luxury goods, set to replace the existing cess. While the implementation date is pending, 5% and 18% slabs take effect from September 22. Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman announced the move, highlighting reduced tax burdens for the common person.
title: Special GST slab of 40%: Which items are under this new tax category

author: CHIDANAND RAJGHATTA
title: 'Can sign deal with India': Trump leaves door open for New Delhi; presses for more

author: TOI WORLD DESK
title: 'It will end!' Trump's ultimatum to Hamas; demands immediate release of all hostages

author: TOI NEWS DESK
title: 'Not done Phase-2 or 3': Trump hints at more action against India

author: TOI BUSINESS DESK
description: President Trump's tariff hike on Indian goods, intended to curb Russian oil purchases, backfired. Russia lowered prices, enticing India to resume buying, while China increased its intake of Russian crude. Consequently, Russian oil is more entrenched in Asia, strengthening black market networks and driving India, Russia, and China closer together, undermining the intended pressure on Moscow.
title: The 50% misfire: How Trump made Russian oil cheaper for India - And Putin a winner

author: TOI TECH DESK
description: Geoffrey Hinton, the "Godfather of AI," cautions that artificial intelligence could soon surpass human capabilities, including emotional manipulation. He suggests AI's ability to learn from vast datasets enables it to influence human feelings and behaviors more effectively than humans. Hinton advocates for ethical foresight in AI development, emphasizing the danger of persuasive AI over physical threats.
title: Godfather of Al warns: Killer robots not dangerous; it's AIs we don't suspect

author: TOI BUSINESS DESK
description: Indian companies are strategically targeting rural markets to sustain growth amidst challenges posed by substantial US tariffs. Companies across various sectors are reporting strong rural consumer demand, fueled by stable prices and anticipated good harvests.
title: Insulated from Trump's tariffs: Companies target small towns for growth; here’s why

author: GLOBAL SPORTS DESK
description: Kawhi Leonard, who joined the Clippers in 2019, is now linked to a fraudulent tree-planting company, Aspiration, allegedly funded by Steve Ballmer. Leonard reportedly signed a $28 million "no-show job" endorsement deal with Aspiration through KL2 Aspire LLC. The Clippers deny circumventing the salary cap, while Aspiration is under U.S. government investigation.
title: Leonard tied to scam deal: Fraud company exposed; 'No-show' promo sparks outrage

author: TOI WORLD DESK
description: Pakistan is forcing out thousands of registered Afghan refugees amidst a humanitarian crisis in Afghanistan, triggered by a recent devastating earthquake. Despite holding official UN registration, families are fleeing due to fear of arrest and harassment, exacerbating the challenges faced by a nation already grappling with immense loss and destruction.
title: Painted as 'terrorists': Afghan refugees expelled from Pakistan, despite deadly quake

author: TOI WORLD DESK
description: Xi Jinping is positioning China as the anchor of global stability, capitalizing on Trump's confrontational foreign policy that has alienated allies and emboldened rivals. This shift is evident in China's growing convening power, attracting nations once aligned with the West. While not yet a new world order, China's rise offers a multi-aligned alternative, challenging US dominance and reshaping global governance.
title: Xi's 'anti-American party': How bullies lose friends - Just ask Trump

author: TOI TECH DESK
description: Elon Musk predicts Tesla's future value will heavily rely on its Optimus humanoid robot initiative, potentially contributing 80% of the company's worth. This shift comes as Tesla's vehicle deliveries face a decline, prompting a focus on robotics. The company's Master Plan Part 4 emphasizes integrating AI into physical products to accelerate global prosperity and human thriving.
title: Tesla future: Musk sees Tesla deriving 80% of value not from EVs, but robots

author: TOI TECH DESK
description: Vivian Wilson, Elon Musk's daughter, asserts her financial independence despite her father's wealth, sharing that she lives with roommates to save money. The aspiring model, who recently graced Teen Vogue, navigates newfound fame while striving to be recognized beyond her family connections. Wilson, who cut ties with Musk in 2022, aims to establish her own identity.
title: ‘Not hundreds of thousands’: Musk’s daughter says she’s broke; opens up on fame, father

author: TOI NEWS DESK
title: Another landslide strikes Mata Vaishno Devi shrine; debris blocks route

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: Irfan Pathan is facing renewed scrutiny after an old interview clip suggesting MS Dhoni's hookah habits and alleged favoritism resurfaced, sparking online debate. A fan questioned Pathan about the claims on Mohammed Shami's birthday post. Pathan responded humorously, tagging Dhoni and saying they would enjoy hookah together.
title: Hookah controversy! Irfan Pathan tags MS Dhoni, says 'sath baith kar pienge'

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: After an old video of an Irfan Pathan interview resurfaced on social media and resulted in a massive speculation and debate on the way MS Dhoni managed the dressing room, Pathan himself has come forward to address the same. The former India all-rounder explained that his comments are being twisted and taken in a different context than intended, that too, half-a-decade after it came out.
title: Hookah storm! Irfan Pathan breaks silence after Dhoni video controversy; comments on 'PR lobby'

author: TOI NEWS DESK
description: The Army released a video showcasing Operation Sindoor, which involved precision strikes on terror sites in Pakistan following the Pahalgam attack that killed 26 civilians. The operation targeted nine terror sites in Pakistan-occupied Kashmir, eliminating over 100 terrorists. A ceasefire was declared after communication between the Indian and Pakistani DGMOs, following an announcement by then US President Donald Trump.
title: Op Sindoor: Army's new video sets record straight on ceasefire - watch

author: SUMIT ROY
description: Bubba the Love Sponge is pushing back against a lawsuit filed by Nick Hogan aimed at halting the premiere of a Hulk Hogan documentary. Bubba claims he has no ownership or control over the film and believes Nick is misdirecting his legal efforts. He insists the documentary portrays Hulk Hogan favorably, highlighting his victimhood rather than casting blame.
title: 'Shown in a bad light': Bubba defends as Nick Hogan sues over Hulk Hogan doc

author: SAHIL MALHOTRA
description: The associations earlier followed a mark of 16.5 as cut-off for yo-yo but showed leniency by selecting even those who posted 14 as, unlike the Virat Kohli-Ravi Shastri era, there was no strict directive from the Indian cricket board. Compared to the world standards, India's Yo-Yo marker wasn't stiff but even then plenty of superstars found it difficult to pass the assessment between what became the dreaded cones in Indian cricket.
title: Bronco or Yo-Yo: Fitness takes centre stage in Indian cricket, but is it sustainable?

author: TOI NEWS DESK
title: Dog custody: Delhi HC's advise to Mahua, Dehadrai

author: TOI TECH DESK
description: Google introduced a new feature called 'Preferred sources' on August 12, 2025, initially in India and the US (English). This allows users to select trusted news outlets, like Times of India, to see more of their coverage in Top stories and a 'From your sources' section.
title: Google’s ‘Preferred sources’ in Search: How to add Times of India

author: TOI BUSINESS DESK
description: The GST Council is expected to approve significant tax rate changes for footwear and apparel, potentially reducing the tax burden on consumers. Items priced up to Rs 2,500 may fall under the 5% GST slab. The council also intends to eliminate the 12% and 28% slabs, streamlining the tax structure and promoting economic transparency.
title: GST relief: Footwear to get cheaper? Rate on apparels priced up to Rs 2,500 cut to 5%

author: TOI NEWS DESK
description: In a tragic turn of events, a newborn girl, already weakened by congenital anomalies and abandoned by her parents, died in an Indore hospital after being bitten by rats.
title: Indore hospital rat infestation: Second newborn girl dies

author: TOI TECH DESK
description: BlackRock has prohibited employees from using company-issued devices during China business trips, effective July 16, amid escalating geopolitical tensions. This decision follows Wells Fargo's suspension of China travel after a banker's detention, raising concerns across Wall Street. The restrictions reflect heightened security fears and operational challenges for global firms navigating US-China relations.
title: No phones, laptops: Asset manager warns staff travelling to China; security risk cited

author: TOI WORLD DESK
description: A Beijing parade featuring Xi Jinping alongside Putin and Kim Jong Un has sparked EU criticism, with concerns raised about a challenge to the Western-led global order. The event, marking the end of World War II, showcased China's military might and growing ambitions. Trump accused the leaders of conspiring against the US, while the Kremlin dismissed the claims.
title: 'Not just optics': EU diplomat says Xi-Putin-Kim meet a bid for 'new world order'

author: CHIDANAND RAJGHATTA
title: Piqued Trump accuses Xi of conspiring against US as China parade stuns world

author: GLOBAL SPORTS DESK
description: Raja Jackson, son of MMA star Quinton “Rampage” Jackson, faces potential legal trouble after allegedly assaulting wrestler Syko Stu at a KnokX Pro Wrestling Academy event. The LAPD investigation is likely to be taken over by California state authorities. Syko Stu is now recovering from severe injuries, including head trauma and jaw fractures.
title: Raja Jackson under LAPD lens: Syko Stu links emerge; legal heat intensifies

author: TOI WORLD DESK
description: A hot-mic moment captured Russian President Vladimir Putin and Chinese President Xi Jinping discussing biotechnology's potential to extend human life, possibly up to 150 years, with North Korean President Kim Jong Un observing. The exchange occurred during a military parade in Beijing, where Xi warned of a global crossroads between peace and war while showcasing China's military strength.
title: Rule forever? What Putin, Xi hot-mic moment revealed

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: Robin Uthappa has criticized Lalit Modi and Michael Clarke. They released a video of the 2008 IPL 'Slapgate' incident. The video showed Harbhajan Singh slapping S Sreesanth. Uthappa questioned the insensitivity of releasing the video. He highlighted potential racial double standards in cricket. He suggested similar incidents involving non-Indian players are often handled differently. He emphasized the need for empathy.
title: Slapgate scandal: Ex-cricketer blasts Lalit Modi for reviving Harbhajan-Sreesanth episode

author: TOI NEWS DESK
title: More S-400s soon? Russia, India in talks; Pak conflict in focus

author: GLOBAL SPORTS DESK
description: Dallas haircare brand Divi collaborates with Brittany Mahomes. She is the wife of Kansas City Chiefs quarterback Patrick Mahomes. Brittany will be the central figure in Divi’s campaign. Divi focuses on scalp and hair health. They aim to leverage Brittany's presence. Divi will release a limited-edition Brittany Mahomes bundle. Fans can recreate her signature healthy hair look.
title: Brittany Mahomes x Divi: Haircare collab unveiled; game-day glam set for 2025

author: SANJAY SHARMA
description: CBSE and NCB have signed a Memorandum of Understanding to combat substance abuse in schools and promote a drug-free environment. The MoU outlines collaborative efforts such as awareness programmes, teacher training, counselling, and digital resources. A pilot programme will begin in 100 CBSE schools. Senior officials attended the event, followed by an awareness session for over 500 educators. This initiative aims to create a safe and supportive ecosystem for students across CBSE-affiliated schools in India.
title: CBSE–NCB tie-up: 100 schools to pilot drug-free drive; 500+ teachers trained

author: TOI NEWS DESK
description: Tejashwi Yadav has strongly criticized PM Modi, accusing him of hypocrisy in the mother 'abuse' row, citing past controversial remarks. Yadav highlighted Modi's comments about Nitish Kumar's "DNA" and his campaigning for rape accused Prajwal Revanna.
title: 'Double standards': Tejashwi digs up PM's remarks amid mother 'abuse' row

author: JYOTIRMOY HALDER
description: The FIDE Grand Swiss 2025 in Samarkand will feature World Champion D Gukesh and Women’s World Cup winner Divya Deshmukh, alongside a strong Indian contingent. Gukesh aims to maintain momentum, while Deshmukh seeks to test herself against top players. With Candidates spots and significant prize money at stake, the tournament promises intense competition and a showcase of India's chess talent.
title: FIDE Grand Swiss: Divya only Indian female in Open section; Gukesh in contention

author: TOI BUSINESS DESK
description: Gold prices in Delhi reached a new record high, driven by expectations of a US Federal Reserve rate cut. Geopolitical tensions and concerns about the US economy also contributed to the surge. Silver traded flat, maintaining its record level. Globally, spot gold hit an all-time high, while spot silver saw a slight decrease.
title: Gold prices cross Rs 1.07 lakh per 10 g in Delhi

author: TOI ENTERTAINMENT DESK
description: Ileana D’cruz, residing in Houston with her husband Michael Dolan, expressed her longing to return to acting after becoming a mother of two. While she misses being on screen and working with talented individuals, she prioritizes being a hands-on mom to her sons.
title: Ileana on comeback: 'Balancing motherhood & films'; 'aware of fickle world'

author: TOI WORLD DESK
description: Satellite images reveal intensified construction at Israel's Dimona nuclear facility, sparking debate about its purpose and Israel's nuclear status. Experts suggest the new structure could be a reactor or a nuclear arms assembly site. Israel's nuclear program, established with French assistance in the 1950s, remains unacknowledged, and the nation has not joined the Nuclear Nonproliferation Treaty.
title: Israel building new nuke reactor? Experts raise alarm over satellite images

author: TOI WORLD DESK
description: Lucy Guo, at 30, has become the world's youngest self-made woman billionaire, surpassing Taylor Swift, thanks to her stake in Scale AI. She dropped out of Carnegie Mellon after the Thiel Fellowship to co-found the AI data-labeling company. Guo's entrepreneurial journey, from trading Pokémon cards to leading in AI and venture capital, showcases her disciplined work ethic and innovative spirit.
title: Meet Lucy Guo: World’s youngest self-made woman billionaire; know her achievements

author: TOI WORLD DESK
description: Amidst trade tensions between the US and India and renewed calls to restrict H-1B visas, entrepreneur Karl Mehta criticized MAGA commentator Charlie Kirk's anti-Indian remarks. Kirk's statements about Indian workers displacing Americans and the US being "full" drew backlash. Mehta defended the contributions of Indian engineers and doctors to the US economy, expressing concerns over the safety of Indian-Americans.
title: 'No such thing as visas for people from India': MAGA influencer schooled for racist post

author: TOI NEWS DESK
description: External Affairs Minister Jaishankar emphasized the importance of predictability in global politics amidst shifting relations with China and US tariffs. He highlighted the need for closer collaboration between India, the EU, and Germany due to global strategic and economic volatility. Wadephul stressed the Western nations' desire for peace in Ukraine, noting Russia's unwillingness to negotiate despite efforts.
title: 'Predictability has huge premium': EAM on India-Germany ties amid Trump tariff war

author: TOI NEWS DESK
description: North India is facing severe hardship due to continuous rains. Rivers are overflowing, disrupting travel and forcing school closures. The India Meteorological Department issued red alerts for several regions. Punjab is experiencing its worst floods since 1988. Himachal Pradesh declared itself a disaster-affected state. Rescue operations are underway in Jammu and Kashmir.
title: Rain batters north India: Scores dead; roads flooded, schools shut

author: TOI LIFESTYLE DESK
description: Teachers' Day in India honors Dr. Sarvepalli Radhakrishnan, celebrating teachers' vital role in shaping lives. Students express gratitude for their mentors' guidance and dedication. In 2025, individuals can use heartfelt wishes, messages, and quotes to appreciate teachers' profound impact on their academic and personal growth, acknowledging their invaluable contributions.
title: Teachers Day 2025: 100+ best wishes, quotes and images for FB and WA

author: RASHMI DROLIA
description: A tragic incident in Chhattisgarh's Jashpur district claimed three lives and left 22 injured when a speeding SUV crashed into a Ganesh idol immersion procession late Tuesday night. The event unfolded in Jurudand village, Bagicha region, as a Bolero car veered into a crowd of devotees.
title: 3 killed, 22 injured as SUV rams into Ganesh immersion procession in Chhattisgarh

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: Sikandar Raza, at 39, has achieved the number one all-rounder ranking in ICC Men’s ODI, driven by consistent performances with both bat and ball during the series against Sri Lanka. Despite Zimbabwe's series loss, Raza's individual brilliance stood out, highlighted by back-to-back half-centuries and impactful bowling.
title: 'Age just a number': 39-yr Sikandar Raza; 35-yr Keshav Maharaj take top ICC spots

author: SUDEEPT MISHRA
description: In Bhopal, TT Nagar police solved a murder case within 24 hours. The victim's boyfriend, Mubeen Khan, confessed to the crime. Police recovered the murder weapon based on his information. Mubeen killed his girlfriend because she refused to break off her engagement. He entered her house and slit her throat. The accused is now in jail.
title: Boyfriend arrested for slitting 19-year-old’s throat in MP's Panchsheel Nagar

author: TOI WORLD DESK
description: Hindu advocacy group HinduPACT is asking for Peter Navarro's removal. The group condemns his remarks as inappropriate and Hinduphobic. They object to his reference to caste and portrayal of Narendra Modi in prayer. AHAD says Navarro's rhetoric endangers Hindus and threatens the relationship between India and US. They criticize his comments about Brahmins, calling it a colonial stereotype.
title: 'Colonial-era trope': Hindu group urges Trump to sack Navarro over Brahmin remark

author: TOI TECH DESK
description: Amidst significant AI transformation and workforce restructuring, Microsoft CEO Satya Nadella has urged employees to embrace a "growth mindset." He emphasized the importance of continuous learning and improvement as the company shifts towards becoming an "intelligence engine." Nadella framed these challenges as career-defining opportunities, encouraging employees to connect personal growth with Microsoft's global mission.
title: Culture at Microsoft: Satya Nadella to employees; 'This is what he wants them to do'

author: TOI NEWS DESK
description: Delhi CM Rekha Gupta resumed her public hearing program, Jan Sunwai, amidst heightened security following a recent attack. Citizens gathered to present grievances, with Gupta assuring swift action. Security measures included frisking, CCTV surveillance, and a protective police ring. Gupta emphasized the importance of public service and resolving citizen issues, directing officials to address concerns promptly.
title: Delhi Jan Sunwai: CM Rekha Gupta holds first programme after attack

author: etimes.in
description: Gauahar Khan and Zaid Darbar joyfully announced the arrival of their second son, born on September 1st. Their firstborn, Zehaan, is excited to share his world with his new baby brother. The couple expressed their gratitude and requested continued blessings for their growing family, receiving an outpouring of love and congratulations from fans and industry colleagues.
title: Gauahar Khan and Zaid Darbar welcome baby boy: “Zehaan is overjoyed to welcome his brother”

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: Irfan Pathan's relationship with MS Dhoni is under scrutiny again after an old interview resurfaced, suggesting Dhoni's alleged favouritism towards hookah-smoking players. This contrasts with Pathan's earlier statements about his close friendship with Dhoni, Suresh Raina, and Robin Uthappa. Despite his all-round abilities, Pathan's career ended abruptly, leading to speculation about Dhoni's influence on his exclusion.
title: Hookah controversy! Irfan Pathan on MS Dhoni: 'Mere bina khana nahi khate the'

author: TOI BUSINESS DESK
description: Donald Trump has accused India of being the 'most tariffed nation,' claiming a historically one-sided trade relationship favoring India. He stated India offered a 'no tariff' deal, but it's 'getting late.'
title: India ‘kills us with tariffs’: Trump throws another tantrum amid trade war

author: TOI TECH DESK
description: Ahead of the anticipated September 9 'Awe Dropping' event, projections suggest stable pricing for the iPhone 17 series, except for the Pro model. JPMorgan forecasts the iPhone 17 at $799, the Air between $899-$949, and the Pro Max at $1,199. The iPhone 17 Pro is expected to cost $1,099, potentially justified by a storage upgrade to 256GB.
title: iPhone 17 series price leak: This model to get costlier; others to cost same

author: GLOBAL SPORTS DESK
description: G FUEL, the popular energy drink among gamers, has sparked widespread speculation with a cryptic message on X, hinting at the "end of an era." The post, thanking fans for their support, led to concerns about a potential shutdown. However, rumors of a major rebrand, including a new logo and updated formula, are also circulating.
title: Is G FUEL really shutting down? Brand’s viral 'end of era' post sparks confusion

author: TOI WORLD DESK
description: Russia refuted Donald Trump's claim that Vladimir Putin, Kim Jong Un, and Xi Jinping were conspiring against the US during a Beijing military parade. The Kremlin dismissed Trump's accusation as potentially ironic, emphasizing that no such conspiracy existed among the leaders. Xi Jinping's address highlighted a global choice between peace and war during the parade.
title: Is Trump being ironic? Russia rejects 'conspiracy against US' charge on Putin, Xi, Kim

author: TOI WORLD DESK
description: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu has criticised countries planning to recognise Palestine, comparing their actions to abandoning others to face a 'grizzly bear' of terrorism. He argues that no one can outrun terrorism and that the only solution is to confront and defeat it together.
title: 'Right then, right now': Netanyahu shares old interview; likens Palestine recognition to fleeing a ‘grizzly bear’

author: TOI WORLD DESK
description: An Indonesian helicopter, carrying eight passengers including an Indian national, Santha Kumar, crashed in a mountainous region after emitting white smoke. Contact was lost on Monday morning. A teacher reported seeing the helicopter flying low and releasing smoke. Search and rescue teams are conducting aerial and ground operations, facing challenges due to heavy rainfall and dense forest.
title: Smoke-emitting chopper missing in Indonesia mountains; Indian among 8 onboard

author: TOI WORLD DESK
description: During bilateral talks in Beijing, Kim Jong Un pledged his full support to Vladimir Putin, expressing readiness to provide all possible assistance to Moscow. Putin praised North Korean soldiers' bravery, claiming they fought alongside Russian troops. Kim highlighted strengthened ties since last year's strategic partnership pact, considering support for Russia a "fraternal duty."
title: Talks in China: Kim Jong Un promises to help with 'everything'; hugs Putin goodbye

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: Alastair Cook and Michael Vaughan have called for significant reforms to Test cricket rules. Cook suggested allowing teams to take two new balls within 160 overs at their discretion, while Vaughan advocated for broader substitution rules beyond concussion replacements to maintain match quality. Both believe these changes are crucial for Test cricket's competitiveness and player welfare.
title: Test cricket: 'Game reduced in quality'; ex-England captains call for big reforms

author: TOI ENTERTAINMENT DESK
description: Vivek Agnihotri, known for films like 'The Kashmir Files,' revealed he convinced Javed Akhtar to retain 'Billo Rani' in the song from 'Dhan Dhana Dhan Goal.' Despite differing political views, Agnihotri deeply respects Akhtar's intellect and acknowledges his contributions to Indian cinema, particularly his lyrics in 'Lagaan' and screenwriting that shaped Amitabh Bachchan's iconic roles.
title: Vivek Agnihotri says he convinced Javed Akhtar to keep ‘Billo Rani’ song

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: RCB captain Rajat Patidar addressed fans following the tragic stampede after their IPL victory parade, expressing condolences and solidarity. Virat Kohli echoed these sentiments, acknowledging the heartbreak and offering prayers. RCB announced a compensation package, a memorial, and safety measures, while a judicial commission held organisers responsible for safety lapses.
title: 'We'll find our strength again': RCB captain breaks silence on stampede tragedy

author: TOI WORLD DESK
description: Donald Trump asserted the US economy's strength under his leadership, attributing it to tariffs while criticizing India's trade practices, citing Harley-Davidson as an example. He claimed India imposes high tariffs while benefiting from minimal barriers in the US market. Trump also reiterated claims of settling wars, including averting potential nuclear conflict between India and Pakistan, amid strained US-India relations.
title: 'Without US, world will die': Trump hails America as 'hottest, best'

author: NEEL KAMAL
description: Punjab faces its worst floods in decades, declared a disaster-affected state, with over 1,200 villages impacted and lakhs of people affected. Authorities are implementing emergency measures, including restoring essential services and ensuring uninterrupted connectivity. Extensive farmland is submerged, causing devastating crop losses, and livestock has been lost, severely impacting rural households. Water levels in major dams are dangerously high.
title: Punjab declared disaster-hit state: Over 1,200 villages submerged in worst floods

author: KUSHAGRA DIXIT
description: The Yamuna River in Delhi has surged past the danger mark, displacing over 10,000 people across 28 locations. Water levels are expected to rise further, potentially breaching a 63-year high. Increased water discharge from Haryana's Hathnikund barrage is exacerbating the situation, leading to traffic diversions and concerns about prolonged flooding in low-lying areas.
title: Delhi flood alert: In 63 years, Yamuna breached 207m only in four rainy seasons

author: MOHD DILSHAD
description: Arun Rajput, a 25-year-old truck driver from Mainpuri, has been arrested for allegedly strangling his 52-year-old lover, Rani Devi, after discovering her true age and facing pressure to marry her. Rani, who concealed her age using social media filters, had an affair with Arun, during which he allegedly took Rs 1.5 lakh from her.
title: UP woman hid 27-year age gap; killed by lover after marriage pressure

author: TOI WORLD DESK
description: Kim Jong Un's daughter, believed to be Ju Ae, made her first public appearance abroad in Beijing, sparking speculation about her potential succession. South Korean intelligence suggests she is the leading candidate, despite doubts about a female ruler in the dynasty. Ju Ae has been increasingly visible at high-profile events, hinting at a growing role within the regime.
title: Kim Jong Un’s 13-year old daughter makes international debut appearance

author: RAJIV KALKOD
description: Bengaluru police are investigating the alleged suicide of 28-year-old Poojashree, a mother of a 10-month-old, following a complaint filed by her mother. The complaint alleges repeated dowry harassment and an extramarital affair involving her husband, Nandish. Poojashree reportedly faced physical and mental abuse when she confronted him, despite family interventions. A case has been registered, and the investigation is underway.
title: After Bengaluru techie death, another woman dies of 'dowry harassment'

author: TOI BUSINESS DESK
description: India's services sector experienced its strongest expansion in 15 years in August, fueled by robust demand and increased international orders, as indicated by the HSBC India Services PMI. New business surged, supported by rising export orders across Asia, Europe, the Middle East, and the US.
title: Booster shot! Services sector PMI hits 15-year high; surges to 62.9

author: TOI BUSINESS DESK
description: Edward Price, a US analyst, criticizes President Trump's tariffs on India, advocating for their removal and an apology. He emphasizes the crucial role of the US-India relationship in the 21st century, particularly in relation to China and Russia. Price also acknowledges concerns about Trump's potential financial interests influencing US-India relations, while praising PM Modi's strategic independence.
title: 'Bring India tariffs to zero and apologise’: US analyst urges Trump amid trade war

author: TOI Education
description: The Central Board of Secondary Education (CBSE) has issued a circular tightening rules for correcting Class 10 and 12 students’ demographic details. Highlighting repeated lapses by schools, CBSE has mandated strict verification during admission, registration, and LOC submission. Incomplete or undocumented requests will now be rejected, placing accountability on schools and parents to ensure 100% accurate student records before results.
title: CBSE warns schools: Sloppy data checks blamed; delays warned

author: TOI Education
description: A newly launched school nutrition education programme in Delhi is set to benefit over 6,000 people, including 1,500 children. Implemented across six schools, it integrates food literacy into classrooms with games, toolkits, and teacher training. Students are being empowered as ambassadors of healthy living, driving a healthier future for their communities.
title: Delhi launches nutrition drive: 6,000+ covered; students drive effort

author: TOI WORLD DESK
description: Frontier Airlines is offering its GoWild! unlimited travel pass for a limited time at $299, valid from September 2-5, 2025. This pass allows passengers to book unlimited domestic and international flights for just a penny plus taxes and fees. Purchasers also receive a complimentary GoWild! pass valid immediately and another for 2026-27, offering 20 months of travel.
title: Frontier Airlines’ GoWild! offer: Unlimited travel pass for $299 launched

author: TOI TECH DESK
description: In a significant antitrust ruling, a US court has allowed Google to retain its Android OS, Chrome browser, and its deal with Apple. However, Google must now share search data with rivals to foster competition, especially from AI-powered search engines. Alphabet's shares rose following the verdict, which also restricts Google from exclusive contracts, potentially reshaping the online search market.
title: Google antitrust ruling: Court allows Android, Chrome; Orders data sharing with rivals

author: TOI BUSINESS DESK
description: The 56th GST Council meeting, presided over by Nirmala Sitharaman, is set to introduce significant changes to India's indirect taxation framework. The council is considering consolidating GST rates, potentially eliminating the 12% and 28% categories, and shifting items to 5% or 18% brackets.
title: GST council meeting: What will become cheaper after rate cuts?

author: TOI NEWS DESK
description: Uttar Pradesh Congress chief Ajay Rai suggests Rahul Gandhi may expose alleged vote theft in Varanasi, hinting at a potential 'hydrogen bomb' revelation. This follows Gandhi's claim of an 'atom bomb' expose in Bengaluru and accusations against the Election Commission and BJP regarding vote manipulation. Modi's victory margin in Varanasi was notably lower this election.
title: 'Hydrogen bomb in Varanasi': Rahul's next vote theft 'expose' may be on PM Modi's seat

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: Aakash Chopra questioned Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma's decisions to retire from Test cricket while continuing in ODIs, suggesting they could aim for the 2027 World Cup. He felt their reduced game time is a concern and believed Kohli's legacy will be judged on batting records, noting the absence of ICC trophies under his captaincy.
title: 'IPL, then 10 games in 10 months': Ex-cricketer questions Kohli-Rohit

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: Irfan Pathan's old interview resurfaced, reigniting discussions about his relationship with MS Dhoni. Pathan hinted at a lack of communication regarding his exclusion from the national team.
title: Irfan Pathan and MS Dhoni: The hookah controversy explained

author: TOI CITY DESK
description: K Kavitha, recently suspended from BRS, alleges a conspiracy against her by certain party leaders. She claims hostility and accuses detractors of targeting her for raising crucial issues. Kavitha expressed disappointment over lack of support from her brother, KT Rama Rao, during a malicious campaign.
title: K Kavitha resigns from BRS, MLC seat a day after suspension

author: TOI LIFESTYLE DESK
description: A global study reveals a widening gap between lifespan and healthspan, indicating people are living longer but spending more years in poor health. This disparity, approximately nine years worldwide, is influenced by factors like chronic diseases in wealthier regions and infectious diseases in poorer areas. Tailored health policies are crucial to improve the quality of life during extended lifespans.
title: Mayo Clinic study reveals shocking truth: We are living longer, but not healthier

author: SAHIL MALHOTRA
description: Indian cricketers, including Rohit Sharma, recently underwent fitness assessments at the BCCI's Centre of Excellence in Bengaluru following a break. While the Yo-Yo test was conducted, the Bronco drill, recommended by Strength & Conditioning coach Adrian Le Roux, was absent but might be included during the Asia Cup in Dubai.
title: No Bronco Test for India cricketers yet; could happen in Dubai

author: TOI WORLD DESK
description: Russia launched a massive aerial assault on Ukraine, deploying over 500 aerial weapons, primarily targeting western regions. Ukrainian officials reported injuries and damage to residential areas and infrastructure. The overnight attack injured railway workers, prompting Poland to activate its defense aircraft.
title: Over 500 drones: Russia launches attack on western Ukraine; many injured

author: TOI BUSINESS DESK
description: Gold price prediction today: Gold prices are expected to trade sideways with a bullish bias, potentially reaching new highs amid safe-haven demand and expectations of a Fed rate cut. Silver is predicted to continue its bull run. Geopolitical tensions and concerns over the Fed's independence are also supporting gold's upward trajectory, making any dips potential buying opportunities for investors.
title: Price prediction today: Gold, silver rates hit life-time highs. Where are they headed?

author: GLOBAL SPORTS DESK
description: Shaquille O'Neal gifted Tamara Humphries, an 18-year-old wrestler from Pittsburgh, a brand new 2025 Mitsubishi Outlander after learning about her transportation struggles. Humphries, a freshman at the University of Pittsburgh at Johnstown, was finding it difficult to attend practices and tournaments. O'Neal's generous act, sparked by Humphries' social media posts, highlights his commitment to giving back and supporting young athletes.
title: Shaquille O’Neal surprises wrestler Tamara Humphries after her transportation struggles

author: TOI TECH DESK
description: Union Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw introduced Vikram-32, India's first indigenous 32-bit processor, developed by ISRO's SCL. Designed to endure extreme space conditions, it succeeds the VIKRAM160. The processor features a 32-bit architecture, operates at 100 MHz, and includes built-in testability, marking a significant advancement in India's semiconductor capabilities.
title: Vikram-32 explained: Specs & use cases; Things to know about India’s 32-bit chip

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: Virat Kohli has addressed the tragic stampede outside M Chinnaswamy Stadium that resulted in 11 deaths and 75 injuries, calling it a heartbreaking event following RCB's IPL victory. RCB will provide Rs 25 lakh compensation to the victims' families and establish a memorial. A judicial report held organizers responsible for SOP violations, deeming the venue unsafe.
title: Virat Kohli on Bengaluru stampede: 'Nothing prepares you for heartbreak like June 4th'

author: TOI SCIENCE DESK
description: Mediterranean beaches reveal a hidden battle against plastic pollution through Neptune balls, formed by seagrass. These natural bundles trap significant amounts of plastic, highlighting the crucial role of seagrass meadows in combating ocean waste. Protecting these vital ecosystems is essential for both biodiversity and mitigating the impact of plastic pollution.
title: Why plastic-filled Neptune balls are washing up on beaches: Explained

author: BHARTI JAIN
title: 'Stay without passport': Big relief for minority migrants from these 3 nations

author: GLOBAL SPORTS DESK
description: In 2026, the NFL will break its recent tradition of opening Week 1 with a Friday night game due to the Sports Broadcasting Act of 1961, which protects high school and college football. While the Friday opener disappears, the NFL is expanding its international presence, beginning the season with a historic game in Australia.
title: Why NFL’s Friday opener won’t happen in 2026 despite record-breaking TV numbers

author: TOI Education
description: Trump’s administration has imposed sweeping visa restrictions on Palestinians, effectively shutting students and professionals out of the US Education, research, medical treatment, and professional exchanges are being blocked, with visas denied even for officials. While framed as national security, critics see it as political, leaving a generation of Palestinians cut off from vital opportunities abroad.
title: Trump’s visa curbs shut out Palestinian students and professionals: What’s at stake?

author: GLOBAL SPORTS DESK
description: Deion Sanders offers heartfelt advice to Travis Hunter as he navigates fatherhood and his NFL career with the Jacksonville Jaguars. Their bond, forged at Jackson State and Colorado, transcends football. Sanders' guidance emphasizes correcting past shortcomings in fatherhood, reflecting their deep connection as Hunter embraces his roles as a husband, father, and rising NFL star.
title: Travis Hunter gets dad talk from Deion: ‘Like a son’ moment goes viral

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: Mohammad Kaif advocates for Sanju Samson to bat at No.3 in the Asia Cup 2025, ahead of Tilak Varma. Citing Samson's experience and form, Kaif believes he's ideal against Afghanistan, especially facing Rashid Khan. He highlighted Samson's IPL record, South African centuries, and Kerala Cricket League performance.
title: Asia Cup 2025: Ex India player backs Samson ahead of Tilak Varma

author: TOI WORLD DESK
description: Cardi B was found not liable in a civil lawsuit brought by a security guard who alleged the rapper assaulted her at a doctor's office in 2018. Emani Ellis claimed Cardi scratched and spat on her during an argument when the rapper was secretly pregnant. Cardi denied touching Ellis, calling the case frivolous and vowing to countersue similar claims.
title: Cardi B cleared of $24M lawsuit; security guard alleged assault in 2018

author: TOI Education
description: While President Trump’s steel and aluminum tariffs were hailed as victories for American industry, they overshadowed a far-reaching economic impact on higher education. Universities, employing over three million Americans, face threats from restrictive immigration policies and funding constraints. Policies favoring factories protect relatively few jobs while jeopardizing hundreds of thousands in academia, highlighting a misaligned national priority.
title: Donald Trump’s steel tariffs and immigration policies threaten millions of university jobs

author: TRISHA TEWARI
description: Humanities education, once the intellectual cornerstone of American universities, is facing a historic retreat as programmes are cut, enrolments collapse, and funding models prioritise workforce returns over cultural inquiry. While elite institutions and wealthy donors are preserving liberal arts for the privileged, public universities retreat, raising urgent questions of access, democracy, and the future of intellectual life in America.
title: Endangered knowledge: Why humanities education is losing its footing in America

author: ANJALI SINGH
description: Gurgaon was paralyzed by torrential rains, revealing both the city's vulnerabilities and its residents' resilience. Commuters faced flooded roads, exorbitant e-rickshaw fares, and abandoned vehicles. Amidst the chaos, stories of kindness emerged, like a Rapido driver's unwavering patience during a seven-hour traffic jam. While many struggled, some found creative solutions, chartering mini-trucks to navigate the flooded streets.
title: Gurgaon's night of mayhem: Rs 600 for 6km! Water seige not over

author: MAHIYAR PATEL
description: Maratha quota supporters in Mumbai celebrated after activist Manoj Jarange declared their battle with the state government over. Celebrations included shouts of victory, gulal, and firecrackers as protesters expressed hope for improved education and job opportunities for their children. Farmers highlighted the struggles of agriculture and the societal pressure for stable employment, while organizers emphasized the desire for equal opportunities.
title: Quota stir: Manoj Jarange ends fast; departing Marathas celebrate with gulal, crackers & selfies

author: TOI WORLD DESK
description: President Zelenskyy criticized Putin's visit to China, accusing him of evading responsibility for the war in Ukraine and intensifying air attacks. He highlighted the surge in drone strikes coinciding with Putin's diplomatic efforts and condemned Russia's disregard for international efforts to stop the conflict. Zelenskyy also warned of a buildup of Russian forces and vowed to respond with asymmetrical measures.
title: ‘Spinning tales’ in China: Zelenskyy reacts to Putin’s visit

author: TOI WORLD DESK
description: Donald Trump criticized China as Beijing held a large military parade attended by Vladimir Putin and Kim Jong Un. Trump claimed American workers sacrificed their lives for China's freedom, urging recognition of their bravery. He then accused Beijing of conspiring against the U.S., sending regards to Putin and Kim.
title: 'Warmest regards to Putin, Kim as you conspire against US': Trump on China parade

author: TNN
description: In Delhi's Najafgarh, Aman allegedly killed his wife Rajni due to disagreements over her social media activity. He then tried to commit suicide. Neighbours found Rajni dead and Aman unconscious. Police arrived and took Aman to the hospital. He is now in custody. Rajni had thousands of followers on Instagram. The couple often fought about her online presence.
title: 'Was posting reels frequently': Delhi man strangles wife

author: PRATYUSH RAJ
description: The introduction of the rugby-style Bronco Test in the Indian cricketing system, by the current Indian Strength and Conditioning coach Adrian Le Roux, has created a lot of buzz. The 2011 World Cup-winning S&C coach Ramji Srinivasan calls it a much-needed step to improve the endurance of the fast bowlers. Meanwhile, Soham Desai, who recently left the Team India set-up, calls it 'just another test'.
title: What is the Bronco Test? Why is it bad news for Rohit, Shami?

author: TOI LIFESTYLE DESK
description: A new study reveals that azelastine nasal spray, an over-the-counter allergy medication, significantly reduces the risk of COVID-19 infection by approximately 67%. Participants in the study who used the spray experienced lower infection rates, milder symptoms, and shorter illness durations. While not a replacement for vaccines or masks, it offers an additional layer of protection during high-risk situations.
title: This over-the-counter nasal spray can reduce your risk of Covid by 67%, new study claims

author: TOI NEWS DESK
description: BJP IT cell chief Amit Malviya has accused Congress leader Pawan Khera's wife, Kota Neelima, of possessing two active voter IDs. Malviya also targeted Rahul Gandhi for raising voter fraud allegations without due diligence, accusing him of endangering voters by revealing their identities. He further alleged that multiple Congress leaders hold multiple voter IDs, implicating Sonia Gandhi in the controversy.
title: Amit Malviya targets Pawan Khera's wife over 2 voter IDs; drags in Sonia's 1980 entry

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: Team India will participate in the Asia Cup 2025 without a lead sponsor after Dream11 ended its contract due to new online gaming regulations. Consequently, the 'India' logo on the team's jerseys will be more prominent.
title: Asia Cup 2025: Why India is to play without sponsor on jersey

author: AYANTIKA PAL
description: Due to heavy rainfall and flood-like conditions across the NCR, Noida and Ghaziabad authorities have ordered schools to remain closed on Wednesday, September 3, 2025, for students from nursery to Class 12. The order encompasses all schools, including government, aided, CBSE, ICSE, and madrassas.
title: NCR rains: Schools shut in Noida, Ghaziabad amid flood-like conditions; more showers predicted

author: TOI WORLD DESK
description: President Xi Jinping, alongside Putin and Kim Jong Un, showcased China's military might, sending a strong message to the US. Xi affirmed China's rise and warned of a choice between peace and confrontation. Trump responded by accusing the leaders of conspiring against the US, while also highlighting America's support for China during World War II.
title: 'Never intimidated by any bullies': Xi flaunts China's might with Putin, Kim Jong Un

author: TNN
description: The Directorate of Revenue Intelligence (DRI) has issued notices to Sandalwood actress Ranya Rao and three others, imposing a hefty fine of Rs 271 crore for allegedly smuggling 324 kg of gold from Dubai. Ranya Rao, daughter of a senior IPS officer, faces a Rs 102 crore fine.
title: Ranya Rao, 3 others fined Rs 271 crore for smuggling 324 kg gold from Dubai

author: TOI NEWS DESK
description: The India Meteorological Department issued red alerts for multiple districts across northern India due to continuing heavy rainfall, forecasting flash floods and landslides. Jammu & Kashmir, Punjab, Himachal Pradesh, Haryana, and other states experienced significant downpours, with Reasi recording extremely heavy rainfall. Consequently, schools in the Jammu Division will remain closed on September 3rd for safety reasons.
title: Red alert today: IMD issues warning in J&K, Punjab, Himachal for heavy rain

author: TOI ENTERTAINMENT DESK
description: Shilpa Shetty Kundra and Raj Kundra face fraud accusations exceeding Rs 60 crore related to a loan-cum-investment deal. Amidst this controversy, Shilpa Shetty announced the closure of her Mumbai restaurant, Bastian Bandra, with its final day of operation being Thursday. The restaurant, co-owned with Ranjit Bindra, initially opened in 2016 and relocated in 2023.
title: Shilpa Shetty's Bandra restaurant to shut down amid Rs 60 crore fraud case

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: Robin Uthappa revealed that his criticism of Virat Kohli's captaincy, specifically regarding Ambati Rayudu's exclusion from the 2019 World Cup squad, strained their personal relationship. Uthappa admitted he should have discussed his concerns with Kohli privately before making them public. He acknowledged the impact of his comments and learned a valuable lesson about communication within the cricket community.
title: 'Should have spoken first': Uthappa admits fallout with Kohli

author: TOI BUSINESS DESK
description: Stock market today: Nifty50 and BSE Sensex, the Indian equity benchmark indices, opened in green on Wednesday. While Nifty50 was near 24,600, BSE Sensex was up over 50 points.
title: Stock market today: Nifty50 near 24,600; BSE Sensex moves above 80,200

author: GLOBAL SPORTS DESK
description: Morgan Riddle, Taylor Fritz's girlfriend, gains attention at the US Open. Her daring stunts and fashion choices go viral. A video of her balancing on a railing sparks conversation. She also wears a New York-inspired outfit. Riddle aims to make tennis cool. Her presence is a talking point. The New York Times calls her famous. She continues to grab headlines.
title: US Open: Who is Taylor Fritz’s girlfriend Morgan Riddle? Influencer going viral

author: TOI BUSINESS DESK
description: Citigroup recommends buying Nuvoco Vistas, anticipating earnings growth from capacity expansion and price hikes. Motilal Oswal Securities suggests buying Phoenix Mills, projecting growth driven by new mall commissioning. HSBC maintains a buy rating on Bharti Airtel, citing rising ARPU and expanding broadband subscribers. CLSA has an outperform rating on Bajaj Finance, highlighting AI initiatives and NIM expansion.
title: Bharti Airtel, Asian Paints & more: Top stocks on brokers' radar today

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: Ravichandran Ashwin defended Digvesh Rathi's display of personality, while praising Rana's handling of media questions after their on-field clash. Rana, who was provoked, responded with aggressive play, leading West Delhi Lions to victory. Both players were penalized for breaching the code of conduct, but Rana's team ultimately won the league championship.
title: 'Respect for Nitish Rana has grown': R Ashwin on heated moment with Digvesh Rathi

author: TOI ENTERTAINMENT DESK
description: Rajinikanth's 'Coolie' continues its box office run into its third week. The film experienced a weekend surge in collections. However, weekday earnings saw a decline. 'Coolie' has earned Rs 281.30 crore in India so far. 'War 2', another release, lags behind 'Coolie' in earnings. The film 'Coolie' stars Rajinikanth as Deva, a former union leader.
title: 'Coolie' Box Office collection day 20: Rajinikanth’s action film mints Rs 1.10 crore

author: TAMAGHNA BANERJEE
description: A Delhi-Kolkata IndiGo flight faced a significant delay due to a dispute between crew members and a passenger. The crew accused the passenger, a lawyer, of disruptive behavior, including chanting a religious slogan and consuming alcohol on board.
title: Delhi-Kolkata IndiGo chaos: Flyer, crew spar over Har Har Mahadev slogan; flight held up 3 hrs

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: Ravichandran Ashwin is in talks to potentially become the first high-profile Indian cricketer to play in the Big Bash League. Cricket Australia has approached the veteran off-spinner, who recently retired from the IPL, with Melbourne being a possible destination.
title: Post IPL retirement plans: R Ashwin eyes shocking BBL debut – talks already underway

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: Ibrahim Zadran and Sediqullah Atal's consecutive half-centuries propelled Afghanistan to an 18-run victory over Pakistan in the T20 tri-series. Afghanistan's spin trio restricted Pakistan to 151 for 9, successfully defending their total of 169 for 5. Despite Mohammad Haris's late flourish, Afghanistan's early dominance with both bat and ball secured the win.
title: T20 Tri-Series: Zadran and Atal fire for Afghanistan

author: ABHINAV GARG
description: The Delhi High Court denied bail to Umar Khalid, Sharjeel Imam, and seven others in the 2020 Delhi riots "larger conspiracy" case, asserting that freedom of speech cannot justify conspiratorial violence. The court emphasized that while citizens have the right to protest peacefully, such rights are not absolute and must be exercised within legal boundaries.
title: Riots ‘conspiracy’: No bail for Umar, Sharjeel

author: ABHIJAY JHA AND ASHNI DHAOR
description: Heavy rainfall and consistent discharge from Haryana's Hathinikund barrage caused the Yamuna River to swell dangerously in Noida and Ghaziabad, prompting the evacuation of over 600 people and 1,400 animals. Authorities are reinforcing embankments and activating relief centers, learning from the devastating 2023 floods.
title: ‘Anxious nights’: Yamuna 1m over danger mark, 10,000 displaced; Ghaziabad, Noida on alert

author: AMIT KUMAR
description: Defending champions India enter the Asia Cup 2025 as favorites, despite a recent lack of T20I match practice. Irfan Pathan believes India's strong NCA system ensures adequate preparation, cautioning them mainly against Afghanistan's potent spinners. He also highlighted Shubman Gill's vice-captaincy as beneficial and revealed Rohit Sharma's desire to continue playing ODIs, contingent on maintaining fitness and game-time.
title: Asia Cup 2025: Are Suryakumar Yadav’s India undercooked? Big continental test awaits

author: TOI WORLD DESK
title: China military parade: Xi, Putin, Kim in attendance as Beijing flexes military might- watch

author: TOI WORLD DESK
description: The US House of Representatives committee has released the initial set of documents related to the Jeffrey Epstein investigation. Over 33,000 pages were uploaded to the committee website. The Justice Department provided these records. Committee aims for full transparency. More records are expected, with redactions to protect victims. This follows criticism of the Trump administration regarding document release.
title: Epstein Files: US House panel releases first batch; 33,000 investigation documents made public

author: TNN
description: German Foreign Minister Johann David Wadephul is in India to discuss the Ukraine conflict and strengthen trade ties. Talks with S Jaishankar will likely address potential secondary sanctions against Russia, which could impact India's energy relations. Jaishankar is expected to reiterate India's support for dialogue and a peaceful resolution, a message previously conveyed to Vladimir Putin.
title: India-Germany talks: Wadephul in Delhi; Ukraine conflict, trade ties on table

author: PRIYANKA KAKODKAR
description: Manoj Jarange ended his hunger strike after the Maharashtra government conceded to several demands aimed at simplifying the process for Marathas with Kunbi antecedents to obtain OBC certificates. While blanket reservation was deemed legally untenable, the government agreed to implement the Hyderabad gazette and establish village-level committees to facilitate certificate issuance.
title: Maratha quota row: Not all of Jarange’s demands accepted by govt; what latest assurance means

author: TNN
description: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman announced upcoming GST reforms aimed at creating a more open and transparent economy, reducing compliance burdens for small businesses. The proposed changes include simplifying the tax slab structure, streamlining registration and filing processes, and addressing rate concerns across various industries.
title: Next-gen GST reforms will make economy transparent: FM Nirmala Sitharaman

author: TOI ENTERTAINMENT DESK
description: Sidharth Malhotra and Janhvi Kapoor's 'Param Sundari' rebounds at the box office, surpassing Rs 34 crore domestically after a Monday dip. The film's success is fueled by the lead actors' chemistry, Kerala's scenic beauty, and appealing music. Despite an international slowdown, the movie's worldwide earnings have reached Rs 49 crore, with positive reviews highlighting its enjoyable romance.
title: 'Param Sundari' Box Office: Sidharth-Janhvi film picks up on Tuesday; earns over Rs 34 crore

author: GLOBAL SPORTS DESK
description: Taylor Swift and Travis Kelce are engaged, marking a significant milestone for the couple. Swift's impressive $1.6 billion net worth, fueled by her music empire and strategic investments, combines with Kelce's $70 million fortune earned through his NFL career and diverse ventures. Together, they form a power couple with a combined net worth of $1.67 billion.
title: ‘Power couple’: Swift enters engagement with $1.6bn fortune; Kelce adds $70m

author: TOI SCIENCE DESK
description: A powerful solar storm, triggered by a rare cannibal CME on August 30, 2025, struck Earth, impacting power grids and satellites. The event, exceeding initial forecasts, caused geomagnetic disturbances and stunning auroras visible at unusually low latitudes. As Solar Cycle 25 peaks, experts warn of increased space weather events, posing risks to technology and daily life.
title: Solar storm hits Earth with 21 lakh kmph winds; power grids and satellites on high alert

author: TNN
description: Tragedy struck as two Hyderabad students, Chaitanya Tarre and Rishiteja Rapu, lost their lives in a car collision in Essex, UK, early Monday. The accident, involving two cars carrying nine Indian students returning from a Ganesh idol immersion, left five others injured.
title: UK car crash: 2 Hyderabad students dead, 5 hurt after Ganesh immersion

author: BARINDERJIT SALUJA
description: Punjab Police's SSOC has filed a chargesheet against YouTuber Jasbir Singh, accusing him of espionage for Pakistan. The investigation revealed photographs of sensitive locations like Bhakra Dam and an Air Force airstrip on his phone.
title: ‘Spy links’: Punjab YouTuber held with dam, airbase photos; chargesheet cites Pak contact

author: TOI LIFESTYLE DESK
description: A recent ice cream recall in New York, involving The Ice Cream Factory's Vanilla G.Nutt flavor, has raised concerns about undeclared almonds. Sold in select stores, the ice cream poses a risk to those with almond allergies, potentially causing severe reactions. Almond allergies, triggered by proteins like Pru du 6, can manifest in various symptoms, including anaphylaxis.
title: Almond allergy: As FDA recalls ice cream for nut allergy risk, what symptoms to watch for

author: PATHIKRIT CHAKRABORTY
description: In Hardoi, a woman named Sheelu, once accused of her husband's murder, discovered him alive and well in an Instagram reel seven years after his disappearance. Jitendra Kumar, also known as Babloo, was found living a double life in Ludhiana with a second wife. Sheelu's discovery led to Babloo's arrest for bigamy, bringing closure to years of suspicion and hardship.
title: 30-sec reel helps UP woman locate hubby who 'died' 7 years back; living with 2nd wife

author: GLOBAL SPORTS DESK
description: Bill Belichick and Jordon Hudson face backlash after the North Carolina Tar Heels' defeat against TCU, Belichick's first game as coach. A video showing Hudson on the field before the game sparked outrage among fans, who criticized her presence and perceived influence on Belichick. Despite the controversy and fan criticism, Belichick and Hudson have not yet responded to the situation.
title: ‘Embarrassing’: Fans slam Belichick’s moment with Hudson; UNC loss adds fuel to outrage

author: TNN
description: The government has lifted restrictions on ethanol production from various sugarcane sources for the 2025-26 ethanol supply year, prompting a surge in sugar stocks. This decision, aimed at boosting ethanol supply, comes as oil marketing companies prepare to issue tenders. The government will monitor sugar diversion to ensure adequate domestic sweetener availability.
title: ‘Green signal’: Govt lifts curbs on ethanol from cane; sugar rallies, tenders expected

author: DIPAK K DASH
description: Following heavy rain and floods, the National Highways Authority of India (NHAI) is set to airlift nine pieces of heavy construction equipment to restore the damaged Kullu-Manali highway. Restoration work is underway at 12 completely damaged and five partially damaged locations on NH-21. The NHAI has requested assistance from the Himachal Pradesh government to expedite the process.
title: NHAI to fly in heavy equipment to fix Kullu-Manali highway

author: TNN
description: In a tragic incident in Hyderabad, B Satvik, a 23-year-old software professional, died when a rusted streetlight pole collapsed on him while he was riding his bike at Nacharam crossroads. Satvik was returning home when the weakened pole gave way, pinning him underneath. Police confirmed the pole's deterioration due to rust as the cause of the fatal accident.
title: Hyderabad techie dies after rusted streetlight pole falls on him

author: TNN
description: Senior Congress MLA RV Deshpande faced backlash for his insensitive remarks to a woman journalist regarding the lack of a hospital in Joida taluk. When questioned about the urgent need for medical facilities, especially for pregnant women, Deshpande responded with a wink, suggesting her delivery could be arranged elsewhere, sparking condemnation from the BJP who criticized his disrespect towards women.
title: 'We'll get your delivery done elsewhere': Congress MLA Deshpande winks at journalist
